body:
### Problem

This happened when I try to add test for https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32988.
```sh
cat <<EOF >>test/functional/api/vim_spec.lua
it('use both nvim_get_runtime_file and vim.iter', function()
  clear { args = { '-u', 'NORC', '--clean' } }
  api.nvim_get_runtime_file('', true)
  vim.iter {}
  api.nvim_get_runtime_file('', true)
end)
EOF

TEST_FILE=test/functional/api/vim_spec.lua TEST_FILTER='use both nvim_get_runtime_file and vim.iter' make functionaltest
```

```

```

### Expected behavior

no crash.

add a `poke_eventloop` seems workaround it.
```lua
  clear { args = { '-u', 'NORC', '--clean' } }
  n.poke_eventloop()
  api.nvim_get_runtime_file('foo', true)
  vim.iter {}
  api.nvim_get_runtime_file('bar', true)
```

comment_data.body: The backtrace seems incomplete. Is it the full backtrace you obtained with GDB?
Sorry I update the full one.
Can you check if #32992 fixes this?

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: nvim crash when use both `nvim_get_runtime_file` and `vim.iter` in test
